title: Magic
data:
Magic is a very broad term in reference to *Crawl*, potentially referring to many things. An overview of the relevant articles is as follows:

## Contents

- [1 Player spellcasting](#Player_spellcasting)

  - [1.1 Overview](#Overview)
  - [1.2 Mechanics](#Mechanics)
  - [1.3 Lists](#Lists)

- [2 Monster spellcasting](#Monster_spellcasting)

- [3 Magic items](#Magic_items)

## Player spellcasting

Refers to the ability of players to memorize and cast spells. See:

### Overview

- [Spell](/Spell "Spell")
- [Spell school](/Spell_school "Spell school")
- [Spell book](/Spell_book "Spell book")

### Mechanics

- [Spell memorisation](/Spell_memorisation "Spell memorisation")
- [Spell success](/Spell_success "Spell success")
- [Spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power")
- [Magic contamination](/Magic_contamination "Magic contamination")
- [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")
- [Spell hunger](/Spell_hunger "Spell hunger")
- [Miscast effect](/Miscast_effect "Miscast effect")

### Lists

- [List of spells](/List_of_spells "List of spells")
- [List of spells by school](/List_of_spells_by_school "List of spells by school")
- [List of spells by flag](/List_of_spells_by_flag "List of spells by flag")

## Monster spellcasting

Refers to the ability of monsters to cast spells. Note that many monster abilities which are thematically 'innate' are actually implemented as spells in *Crawl*. The following articles and categories provide useful info:

- [The article on player ghosts](/Player_ghost#Spellcasting "Player ghost") provides a good insight into how monster spells are treated.
- [Actual spells](/Actual_spells "Actual spells") (monsters that don't cast spells innately)
- [Spellcaster](/Spellcaster "Spellcaster")

## Magic items

Many items in *Crawl* are, thematically, magical. A complete list would be quite long, but they include:

- [Rings](/Ring "Ring")

- [Amulets](/Amulet "Amulet")

- [Scrolls](/Scroll "Scroll")

- [Evocable items](/Evocable_items "Evocable items"). These include:

  - [Wands](/Wand "Wand")
  - [Magical staves](/Magical_staves "Magical staves")
  - [Summoning items](/Evocable_items#Summoning_Items "Evocable items"), including elemental evokers
  - A few other [miscellaneous items](/Evocable_items#Miscellaneous_Items "Evocable items")

- Armour bearing an [ego](/Ego "Ego")

- Weapons bearing a [brand](/Brand "Brand")

- All [artefacts](/Artefact "Artefact") (the last non-magical one, the [Knife of Accuracy](/Knife_of_Accuracy "Knife of Accuracy"), was removed in [0.13](/0.13 "0.13")

| [Skills](/Skill "Skill")                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Weapons](/Weapons "Weapons")                                         | [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades") • [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades") • [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")[Axes](/Axes "Axes") • [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") • [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms") • [Staves](/Staves "Staves") • [Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat") • [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") |
| Physical                                                              | [Fighting](/Fighting "Fighting") • [Armour](/Armour_\(skill\) "Armour (skill)") • [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging") • [Stealth](/Stealth_\(skill\) "Stealth (skill)") • [Shields](/Shields_\(skill\) "Shields (skill)")                                                                                                                                                              |
| [Magical]()                                                           | [Spellcasting](/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") • [Invocations](/Invocations "Invocations") • [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations") • [Shapeshifting](/Shapeshifting "Shapeshifting")                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| [Spell Schools](/List_of_spells_by_school "List of spells by school") | [Air](/Air "Air") • [Alchemy](/Alchemy "Alchemy") • [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") • [Earth](/Earth "Earth") • [Fire](/Fire_Magic "Fire Magic") • [Hexes](/Hexes "Hexes") • [Ice](/Ice_Magic "Ice Magic") • [Necromancy](/Necromancy "Necromancy") • [Summoning](/Summoning "Summoning") • [Translocations](/Translocations "Translocations")                      |
html:
Magic

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search

Magic is a very broad term in reference to Crawl, potentially referring to many things. An overview of the relevant articles is as follows:

Contents

  • 1 Player spellcasting
    • 1.1 Overview
    • 1.2 Mechanics
    • 1.3 Lists
  • 2 Monster spellcasting
  • 3 Magic items

Player spellcasting

Refers to the ability of players to memorize and cast spells. See:

Overview

  • Spell
  • Spell school
  • Spell book

Mechanics

  • Spell memorisation
  • Spell success
  • Spell power
  • Magic contamination
  • Spell noise
  • Spell hunger
  • Miscast effect

Lists

  • List of spells
  • List of spells by school
  • List of spells by flag

Monster spellcasting

Refers to the ability of monsters to cast spells. Note that many monster abilities which are thematically 'innate' are actually implemented as spells in Crawl. The following articles and categories provide useful info:

  • The article on player ghosts provides a good insight into how monster spells are treated.
  • Actual spells (monsters that don't cast spells innately)
  • Spellcaster

Magic items

Many items in Crawl are, thematically, magical. A complete list would be quite long, but they include:

  • Rings
  • Amulets
  • Scrolls
  • Evocable items. These include:
    • Wands
    • Magical staves
    • Summoning items, including elemental evokers
    • A few other miscellaneous items
  • Armour bearing an ego
  • Weapons bearing a brand
  • All artefacts (the last non-magical one, the Knife of Accuracy, was removed in 0.13
Skills
Weapons Short Blades • Long Blades • Ranged Weapons

Axes • Maces & Flails • Polearms • Staves • Unarmed Combat • Throwing

Physical Fighting • Armour • Dodging • Stealth • Shields
Magical Spellcasting • Invocations • Evocations • Shapeshifting
Spell Schools Air • Alchemy • Conjurations • Earth • Fire • Hexes • Ice • Necromancy • Summoning • Translocations

rawPage:
Magic is a very broad term in reference to ''Crawl'', potentially referring to many things.  An overview of the relevant articles is as follows:

==Player spellcasting==

Refers to the ability of players to memorize and cast spells.  See:

===Overview===
* [[Spell]]
* [[Spell school]]
* [[Spell book]]
===Mechanics===
* [[Spell memorisation]]
* [[Spell success]]
* [[Spell power]]
* [[Magic contamination]]
* [[Spell noise]]
* [[Spell hunger]]
* [[Miscast effect]]
===Lists===
* [[List of spells]]
* [[List of spells by school]]
* [[List of spells by flag]]

==Monster spellcasting==

Refers to the ability of monsters to cast spells.  Note that many monster abilities which are thematically 'innate' are actually implemented as spells in ''Crawl''.  The following articles and categories provide useful info:

* [[Player_ghost#Spellcasting|The article on player ghosts]] provides a good insight into how monster spells are treated.
* [[Actual spells]] (monsters that don't cast spells innately)
* [[Spellcaster]]

==Magic items==

Many items in ''Crawl'' are, thematically, magical.  A complete list would be quite long, but they include:

* [[Ring]]s
* [[Amulet]]s
* [[Scroll]]s
* [[Evocable items]].  These include:
** [[Wand]]s
** [[Magical staves]]
** [[Evocable_items#Summoning_Items|Summoning item]]s, including elemental evokers
** A few other [[Evocable_items#Miscellaneous_Items|miscellaneous items]]
* Armour bearing an [[ego]]
* Weapons bearing a [[brand]]
* All [[artefact]]s (the last non-magical one, the [[Knife of Accuracy]], was removed in [[0.13]]

[[Category:Magic]]
